title: India's Archers Shine at World Youth Championships: 3 Medals in Limerick
content:
India's junior archery team dominated at the World Archery Youth Championships in Limerick, Ireland, securing three medals in the mixed team events. The highlight was the Under-21 compound team's gold medal, won by Avneet Kaur and Priyansh, who beat Israel in a nail-biting final. 

The Under-21 recurve team (Ridhi and Parth Salunkhe) and the Under-18 compound team (Aishwarya Sharma and Manav Jadhao) also bagged bronze medals, adding to India's impressive performance. 

The Indian archers showcased resilience and skill, battling windy conditions and facing stiff competition from top archery nations like Great Britain, Mexico, and South Korea.  This impressive performance promises a bright future for Indian archery on the world stage.
author: Scroll Staff
